intro: Calceolaria lepida, commonly known as the fairy slipper or ghost orchid, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, delicate blooms during the spring and summer seasons. Calceolaria lepida is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is valued for its ornamental beauty.
